clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Therapeutic Value of Periorbital Injection of Glucocorticoid in Mild TAO
clinical_study.official_title: Periorbitally Injected Glucocorticoids for Mild TAO: A Randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether periorbital injection of glucocorticoid is effective and necessary in the treatment of mild TAO.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Clinical Activity Score (CAS) score
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of CAS scores before and after treatment in each arm and an inter-arm. The range of CAS scores is 0-7, with 3 as the boundary. The higher the score, the higher the activity.
Comparison of NOSPECS scores before and after treatment in each arm and an inter-arm. The NOSPECS score was 0-6. The higher the score, the higher the severity.

secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of adverse events rate in each arm and an inter-arm.

Comparison of Graves' ophthalmopathy Quality of life questionnaire (GO-QOL) scores before and after treatment in each arm and an inter-arm. The GO-QOL score is between 0 and 100. The higher the score, the better the quality of life.

arm_group.description: Glucocorticoids periorbital injection. Once every 3 weeks, the number of injections was determined according to the condition of the eyes during the follow-up.

intervention.description: Periorbital injection of glucocorticoid. Once every 3 weeks, the number of injections was determined according to the condition of the eyes during the follow-up.
